typeDescription.name: bachelor.polarity.types.PolarExpression
typeDescription.description: A polar expression. E.g. "m√∂gen, hassen, gut, schlecht, ..."

featureDescription.name: value
featureDescription.description: The numeric value of the polar expression. Positive: 1.0 Neutral: 0 Negative: -1.0

featureDescription.name: category
featureDescription.description:
Category is the second token of a line in the lexicon input. Possible categories: NEG, POS, INT, SHI
Example: "fehlschlagen NEG=0.7 verben " category= NEG

featureDescription.name: mwe
featureDescription.description: True if the expression is a multi word expression, false otherwise.

typeDescription.name: bachelor.polarity.types.SentimentExpression
typeDescription.description: A sentiment expression made up of a polar expression and possibly a shifter.

typeDescription.name: bachelor.polarity.types.Shifter
typeDescription.description: A shifter "shifts" sentiments. Examples: "kein, weniger, nicht, ..."

featureDescription.name: shifter_type
featureDescription.description: The shifter type. There are three different types: g -- general shifter p -- positive shifter n -- negative shifter Examples: beenden [g] vermasseln [p] leugnen [n]

featureDescription.name: shifter_scope
featureDescription.description: Specifies the scope of the shifter, determined by its pos tag. The scope is listed as dependency relations. Examples: <shifterVerb> [<type>][<scope>] <pos> beenden [g][objd,obja,objc,obji,s,obj] verben korrigierbar [g][subj] adj kein [g][attr-rev] adj

featureDescription.name: shifter_pos
featureDescription.description: The pos tag of the shifter.

featureDescription.name: mwe
featureDescription.description: True if the shifter is a multi word expression (mwe), false otherwise.
